pxtextmining.factories package¶

Submodules¶

pxtextmining.factories.factory_data_load_and_split module¶

pxtextmining.factories.factory_data_load_and_split.factory_data_load_and_split(filename, target, predictor, test_size=0.33)¶

Function loads the dataset, renames the response and predictor as “target” and “predictor” respectively, cleans the text in the predictor, splits the dataset into training and test sets.

Parameters

  • filename (str) – Dataset name (CSV), including the data type suffix. If None, data is read from the database.

  • target (str) – Name of the response variable.

  • predictor (str) – Name of the predictor variable.

  • test_size (float) – Proportion of data that will form the test dataset.

Returns

A tuple of length 4: predictor-train, predictor-test, target-train and target-test datasets.

pxtextmining.factories.factory_pipeline module¶

pxtextmining.factories.factory_pipeline.factory_pipeline(x_train, y_train, tknz, metric='class_balance_accuracy_score', cv=5, n_iter=100, n_jobs=5, verbose=3, learners=['SGDClassifier', 'RidgeClassifier', 'Perceptron', 'PassiveAggressiveClassifier', 'BernoulliNB', 'ComplementNB', 'MultinomialNB', 'RandomForestClassifier'])¶

Function prepares and fits an imblearn.pipeline.Pipeline that consists of the following steps: 1. Up-sampling of rare classes. 2. Tokenization and lemmatization of predictor. 3. Feature selection. Uses sklearn.feature_selection.SelectPercentile with sklearn.feature_selection.chi2. 4. Fitting and benchmarking of user-supplied Scikit-learn estimators.

Parameters

  • x_train – Training data (predictor).

  • y_train – Training data (response).

  • tknz (str) – Tokenizer to use (“spacy” or “wordnet”).

  • metric (str) – Scorer to use during pipeline tuning (“accuracy_score”, “balanced_accuracy_score”, “matthews_corrcoef”, “class_balance_accuracy_score”).

  • cv (int) – Number of cross-validation folds.

  • n_iter (int) – Number of parameter settings that are sampled (see sklearn.model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV).

  • n_jobs (int) – Number of jobs to run in parallel (see sklearn.model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV).

  • verbose (int) – Controls the verbosity (see sklearn.model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV).

  • learners (list[str]) – A list of Sci-kit learner names of the learners to tune.

Returns

A fitted imblearn.pipeline.Pipeline.
